roleset.name: translate, shift diachronically into Latin
roleset.note: LATINIZE-V NOTES: Added by Julia for clearearth-biotexts.

example.name: latinisation-n
example.text: Etymology First used in English 1539 , the word parasite comes from the Medieval French parasite , from the Latin parasitus , the latinisation of the Greek \u03c0\u03b1\u03c1\u03b1\u03c3\u03b9\u03c4\u03bf\u03c2 -LRB- parasitos -RRB- , `` one who eats at the table of another '' and that from \u03c0\u03b1\u03c1\u03b1 -LRB- para -RRB- , `` beside , by '' + \u03c3\u03b9\u03c4\u03bf\u03c2 -LRB- sitos -RRB- , `` wheat '' .
example.arg: of the Greek \u03c0\u03b1\u03c1\u03b1\u03c3\u03b9\u03c4\u03bf\u03c2 -LRB- parasitos -RRB- , `` one who eats at the table of another '' and that from \u03c0\u03b1\u03c1\u03b1 -LRB- para -RRB- , `` beside , by '' + \u03c3\u03b9\u03c4\u03bf\u03c2 -LRB- sitos -RRB- , `` wheat '' .
